snippet: The intervention in Spain will do little to address a weakness common to Europe’s financial institutions: an addiction to outside loans that provide day-to-day financing.
abstract: News analysis; European bailout of Spain's wobbling banks will do little to address a weakness common to Europe’s financial institutions: an addiction to outside loans that provide day-to-day financing; investors and analysts worry that highly indebted banks in other weak countries like Italy might face constraints similar to those of Spain in the months ahead.

byline.contributor: Nelson D. Schwartz contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The intervention in Spain will do little to address a weakness common to Europe’s financial institutions: an addiction to outside loans that provide day-to-day financing.

headline.seo: In Europe, Banks Borrowing to Stay Ahead of the Tide
headline.main: In Europe, Banks Borrowing to Stay Ahead of the Tide
headline.print_headline: In Europe, Banks Borrowing To Stay Ahead of the Tide
